messages.message: When I try to connect a google drive, it asks for several permissions. One of them is “delete”. Is that necessary? Is it possible to leave that one out? Same with “edit” access.
No, we need a *lot* of permissions for this
Nope, not configurable. Because we need to both read from and export to the drive, these are the bits Google will ask for.
do we have an FAQ/help page that we can direct people to? i imagine they'll have questions similar to this as well
Don’t have this on an FAQ page afaik, but on our privacy policy page we explain what we’re doing with user data to justify the google scopes (also required for Google app approval)
Heymian is correct, as far as we know this is not configurable. This seems to just come along when we opt to use the drive API from google
We will add information in Docs about this. I agree that the nature of permissions and Google’s language around it will make a lot of people pause and reconsider. @jean
